message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

This paper deals with the design and analysis of regenerating codes, which are used in distributed storage systems. The paper focuses on the repair of failed nodes in such systems, which is a common problem due to the large scale of these systems. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the transmission, processing, and storage of information. Other likely sub-categories include cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
